summary: This FBI case update from October 2023 details investigative steps regarding potential money laundering facilitation involving Cecile deJongh and the Jeffrey Epstein estate. It references a subpoena served on the estate and plans to subpoena JP Morgan Chase for email records between deJongh and Epstein, as well as to examine media concerning ties between the University of the Virgin Islands and the USVI Governor's office.

persons.name: Cecile deJongh
persons.context: Named as the subject of a potential money laundering facilitation investigation; the FBI is seeking a subpoena for JP Morgan Chase records of emails between her and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier, subject of estate proceedings
persons.context: Referenced as the correspondent with Cecile deJongh in emails sought via subpoena to JP Morgan Chase; his estate was served with a subpoena.

persons.name: Lauren Doxey
persons.role: Law Clerk at Patterson Bellknap Webb and Tyler LLP
persons.context: Identified as the representative of the Epstein estate who provided documents in response to a subpoena from the United States Virgin Islands USAO.

connections.description: The FBI is seeking to subpoena JP Morgan Chase records to view emails between deJongh and Epstein as part of a money laundering facilitation investigation.
Doxey, as a law clerk for the firm representing the Epstein estate, acted as the estate's representative in providing documents pursuant to a subpoena.

events.title: Subpoena Served on Epstein Estate
events.description: The United States Virgin Islands USAO provided a copy of a subpoena to the Jeffrey Epstein estate; documents were provided by estate representative Lauren Doxey.

events.title: FBI Case Update and Investigative Planning
events.description: FBI case update documents a phone conversation discussing investigative steps, including a planned subpoena to JP Morgan Chase for email records between Cecile deJongh and Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: New York, NY 10036 (1133 Avenue of the Americas, Patterson Bellknap Webb and Tyler LLP)
keyFacts: As of October 2023, the FBI was actively investigating Cecile deJongh for potential money laundering facilitation in connection with Jeffrey Epstein.
A subpoena was served on the Epstein estate on September 13, 2023, with documents provided by law clerk Lauren Doxey.
A key investigative step planned was a subpoena to JP Morgan Chase to obtain records of emails between Cecile deJongh and Jeffrey Epstein.
Investigators were also examining media concerning ties and VISA requests between the University of the Virgin Islands and the USVI Governor's office.
